verses.verse: Then Bildad <S%H1085><s%> the Shuhite <S%H7747><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>
"How long <S%H5704><s%> will you hunt <S%H7760><s%> for <S%H7078><s%> words? <S%H4405><s%> Consider, <S%H995><s%> and afterwards <S%H310><s%> we will speak. <S%H1696><s%>
Why are we counted <S%H2803><s%> as animals, <S%H929><s%> which have become unclean <S%H2933><s%> in your sight? <S%H5869><s%>

You who tear <S%H2963><s%> yourself <S%H5315><s%> in your anger, <S%H639><s%> shall the earth <S%H776><s%> be forsaken <S%H5800><s%> for you? <S%H6697><s%> Or shall the rock be removed <S%H6275><s%> out of its place? <S%H4725><s%>
"Yes, <S%H216><s%> the light of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> shall be put out, <S%H1846><s%> The spark <S%H7632><s%> of his fire <S%H784><s%> shall not shine. <S%H5050><s%>
The light <S%H216><s%> shall be dark <S%H2821><s%> in his tent. <S%H168><s%> His lamp <S%H5216><s%> above him shall be put out. <S%H1846><s%>
The steps <S%H6806><s%> of his strength <S%H202><s%> shall be shortened. <S%H3334><s%> His own counsel <S%H6098><s%> shall cast him down. <S%H7993><s%>
For he is cast <S%H7971><s%> into a net <S%H7568><s%> by his own feet, <S%H7272><s%> and he wanders into its mesh. <S%H7639><s%>
A snare <S%H6341><s%> will take <S%H270><s%> him by the heel. <S%H6119><s%> A trap <S%H6782><s%> will catch him. <S%H2388><s%>
A noose <S%H2256><s%> is hidden <S%H2934><s%> for him in the ground, <S%H776><s%> a trap <S%H4434><s%> for him in the way. <S%H5410><s%>
Terrors <S%H1091><s%> shall make him afraid <S%H1204><s%> on every side, <S%H5439><s%> and shall chase <S%H6327><s%> him at his heels. <S%H7272><s%>
His strength <S%H202><s%> shall be famished. <S%H7457><s%> Calamity <S%H343><s%> shall be ready <S%H3559><s%> at his side. <S%H6763><s%>
The members <S%H905><s%> of his body <S%H5785><s%> shall be devoured. <S%H398><s%> The firstborn <S%H1060><s%> of death <S%H4194><s%> shall devour <S%H398><s%> his members. <S%H905><s%>
He shall be rooted out <S%H5423><s%> of his tent <S%H168><s%> where he trusts. <S%H4009><s%> He shall be brought <S%H6805><s%> to the king <S%H4428><s%> of terrors. <S%H1091><s%>
There shall dwell <S%H7931><s%> in his tent <S%H168><s%> that which is none <S%H1097><s%> of his. <S%H1614><s%> Sulfur shall be scattered <S%H2219><s%> on his habitation. <S%H5116><s%>
His roots <S%H8328><s%> shall be dried up <S%H3001><s%> beneath. <S%H4605><s%> Above shall his branch <S%H7105><s%> be cut off. <S%H5243><s%>
His memory <S%H2143><s%> shall perish <S%H6><s%> from the earth. <S%H776><s%> He shall have no name <S%H8034><s%> in the street. <S%H6440><s%>
He shall be driven <S%H1920><s%> from light <S%H216><s%> into darkness, <S%H2822><s%> and chased <S%H5074><s%> out of the world. <S%H8398><s%>
He shall have neither son <S%H5209><s%> nor grandson <S%H5220><s%> among his people, <S%H5971><s%> nor any remaining <S%H8300><s%> where he lived. <S%H4033><s%>
Those who come after <S%H314><s%> shall be astonished <S%H8074><s%> at his day, <S%H3117><s%> as those who went before <S%H6931><s%> were frightened. <S%H270><s%>
Surely such are the dwellings <S%H4908><s%> of the unrighteous. <S%H5767><s%> This is the place <S%H4725><s%> of him who doesn't <S%H3045><s%> know God. <S%H410><s%>"
